biogHist.abstract: Carnarvon Teens Hostel was a hostel for around ten young people (male and female) in Carnarvon. It opened in 1968, and was part of the Carnarvon Mission that was run the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board (Inc). The hostel aimed to give young people from Carnarvon Mission (later, Ingada Village) an opportunity to live in the Carnarvon township while going to high school, or while they were working.It was located near the Christian Centre and church, and closed in the mid-1980s.
biogHist.p: In 2014, a police and court complex was being constructed on the site of the Carnarvon Teens Hostel.

chronItem.event: Location - Carnarvon Teens Hostel was in Hubble Street, Carnarvon.

descriptiveNote.p: The Carnarvon Teens Hostel accommodated young people from the Carnarvon Mission who were going to high school or working in the Carnarvon township.
The Carnarvon Teens Hostel accommodated young people from Ingada Village who were going to high school or working in the Carnarvon township.

archref.repository: Global Mission Partners, Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs
archref.abstract: 'Teens Hostel' is a digital copy of an image held by Global Mission Partners in the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs collection. As described by historian Deslee Moyle, the image dates from the late 1960s. The hostel was established in 1968 as part of the Carnarvon Mission. The image shows the hostel (which was also called the 'Town Hostel') on the left, with the Christian Centre's hall in the middle and the church on the right.

'Carnarvon Mission Ingada Village' is a history of the Churches of Christ's management of Carnarvon Mission and the Mission's later name, Ingada Village. It also includes information about the Carnarvon Teens Hostel and was written by Deslee Moyle, who has preserved many archival records relating to the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board (CCFAMB) and the organisation that followed it, the Australian Churches of Christ Indigenous Ministries (ACCIM). The item gives insight into life at the Mission and the Hostel.
